de: Wanderung von Saint Rémy de Provence aus, auf dem Rückweg durch Glanum. Ein kleiner Umweg bis zum Felsen der 2 Löcher lohnt sich!
en: Hike from Saint Rémy de Provence, returning via Glanum. A small diversions to the "Rocher des 2 trous" is worth it!
it: Escursione da Saint Rémy de Provence, con ritorno via Glanum. Una piccola deviazione per la roccia a 2 buchi vale la pena!
fr: Randonnée au départ de Saint Rémy de Provence, en rentrant par Glanum. Un petit détour jusqu'au rocher des 2 trous vaut le coup !
nl: Wandeling vanuit Saint Rémy de Provence, terug via Glanum. Een kleine omleiding naar de 2 gaten rots is de moeite waard!
es: Caminata desde Saint Rémy de Provence, regresando por Glanum. ¡Un pequeño desvío a la roca de 2 agujeros vale la pena!

fr: Le plateau de la Caume à St-Rémy-de-Provence

en:
1. Leave the tourist office, walk along the car park, cross Avenue Pasteur and go up Avenue P Barbier, pass over the Canal des Alpines (canal built between 1672 and 1875 from Lamanon to the north of Tarascon). On the bridge, the marker n°14 "l'herbage aux Papillons" on the walk in the world of Vincent Van Gogh and on your right the Coinon arena. Further on, at the crossroads, turn left onto "la via Domitia" as far as the Croix des Vertus (Av J Baltus then ch de la Croix des Vertus) and follow the red and white GR 653D signs. At the Croix des Vertus, turn right onto the Chemin de Valrugue until the crossroads of the 4 paths (600m).
2. You are on the eastern diverticulum of the Roman road (secondary path to Glanum). From this crossroads, follow the path towards Eygalières by the plateau de la Caume (wooden signpost) or Rome by the GR 653D (an itinerary of the Grande Randonnée St Jacques de Compostelle Arles/Col du Mont-Genèvre). Pass the "dead" cluse and the last properties then you arrive at the foot of the forest, at the DFCI barrier of the fire brigade (Défense de la forêt Contre les Incendies). From there, as far as the archaeological site of Glanum, the itinerary crosses "la Caume", a site protected by a prefectoral decree for the protection of the biotope, due to its interest in flora and fauna.
3. Go up the Valrugue valley by the forest track to the Valrugue pass (under the Caume plateau). At the beginning it is a bit scabrous (you will notice the balsams on each side), passage at the bottom of the gorge, giant stairs for about 200m, then the track becomes "normal" again. Be careful because, with the exception of the wetland habitat, the site covers 500ha of all the habitats you can find in the 50,000ha of the Alpilles massif: rocky habitats, forests and dry grasslands. Animals encountered: Bonelli's eagle, Tichodrome Echelette, red-billed chough, Great Horned Owl, Pitchou warbler, wild boar, roe deer, genet... On the heights of the valley, the view is of the surrounding cliffs, for example the Rocher des 2 Trous.
4. To the east is the Caume plateau with the communication tower, to the west is the asphalt track that descends to the St Clerg valley, follow this track for 800m to the small St Clerg pass, recognisable on the left by a beautiful Atlas cedar and on the right by the AL218 forestry track. Note that it is permissible to make a return trip to the Deux Trous rock. To do this, 200m after the Valrugues pass on the asphalt track to the west, turn right onto the forest track to the foot of the rock. From here, the view plunges down to the valley of St Clerg, the Antiques and St-Rémy, on the left the mount Gaussiers or the "lion of Arles".
5. At the Col de St Clerg, leave the tarmac track for the forest track AL218 on the right. The itinerary follows the St Clerg valley, a botanical trail marked out with markers on the wild plants that can be found in the Alpilles massif and elsewhere: the Garance Voyageuse, the Sarsaparilla, the Spanish Fir, the Boxwood... the Green White and Kermes Oaks. The valley ends at the archaeological site of Glanum, from where you can see some of the remains. The itinerary continues on the path, on the right you can see the Carrières Deschamps (a site protected by a biotope decree necessary for the hibernation and reproduction of bats, do not disturb the tranquillity of the site). The path ends on a small road, at the crossroads, a cross with a stone base and a wooden directional sign. From this point, on the left, if time permits, you can make a round trip to visit the ancient city of Glanum (paying), the capstan of the quarry of St Paul, the different boards of the Van Gogh circuit... and on the right return to St Rémy.
6. Follow the path along the monastery's property which leads to Avenue Marie Gasquet. Walk down this asphalt avenue to the Via Domitia, take the Avenue Pierre Barbier and return to the tourist office by the same route as before.

de: Mitten in der Provence, zwischen der Rhône und der Durance setzt die Alpilles ("Aupilho" provenzalisch) ein Gebirgszug in Szene. Die Route, die bei der Abreise von St-Rémy-de-Provence, geschlungen ist eine Reise zurück in die Zeit (via Domitia, Santiago GR653D, natürlich Vincent Van Gogh...), der höchste Antike bis heute, aber in der Entdeckung der tierischen, pflanzlichen und mineralischen Herrschaft. Nach der Überquerung der ländlichen Welt, folgt der Route ein Pfad in der Natur markiert, Fußabdruck Schutzgebieten, die Casey und Karriere-Websites geregelt wegen der seltenen Arten dieser live dort und verschiedene Landschaften, die es gibt. In diesem Kurs werden Standpunkte nicht fehlen, die außergewöhnlichen Landschaften sind umbenennen International, Stein, Wasser, Wind, Licht und die weltliche Präsenz von Männern befinden sich dieses Land geprägt haben.
en: In the midst of Provence, between the Rhône and Durance, Alpilles ("aupilho" in Provençal) sets the scene for a mountain range. The route looped at the departure of St-Rémy-de-Provence, is a trip back in time (via Domitia, Santiago GR653D, course Vincent Van Gogh...), of the highest antiquity to our days but in the discovery of the animal, vegetable and mineral reign. After crossing the rural world, the route follows a path marked out in nature, footprint protected sites, the Casey and career sites regulated because of the rare species that live there and different landscapes that are there. Throughout this course, viewpoints does not lack, the exceptional landscapes are rename international, stone, water, wind, light, and the secular presence of men who are are located have shaped this land.
it: In mezzo alla Provenza, tra il Rodano e la Durance, Alpilles ("aupilho" in provenzale) mette in scena per una catena montuosa. L'itinerario cappio alla partenza di St-Rémy-de-Provence, è un viaggio indietro nel tempo (via Domitia, Santiago GR653D, corso Vincent Van Gogh...), della più alta antichità ai nostri giorni, ma la scoperta del Regno animale, vegetale e minerale. Dopo aver attraversato il mondo rurale, l'itinerario segue un percorso contrassegnato fuori nella natura, impronta protetti siti, il Casey e siti di carriera regolamentati a causa della rara specie che dal vivo là e diversi paesaggi che ci sono. Durante tutto questo percorso, punti di vista non manca, i paesaggi eccezionali sono Rinomina international, pietra, acqua, vento, luce e la secolare presenza di uomini che sono si trovano hanno plasmato questa terra.
fr: Au beau milieu de la Provence, entre Rhône et Durance, les Alpilles ("aupilho" en provençal) plante le décor d'une chaîne de montagne. L'itinéraire en boucle au départ de St Rémy-de-Provence, est un voyage dans le temps (via Domitia, Compostelle GR653D, parcours Vincent Van Gogh...), de la plus haute antiquité à nos jours mais aussi dans la découverte du règne animal, végétal et minéral. Après avoir traversé le monde rural, le parcours suit un cheminement balisé en pleine nature, empreinte les sites protégés de la Caume et celui des carrières, sites réglementés en raison des espèces rares qui y vivent et des différents paysages qui s'y trouvent. Tout au long de ce parcours, les points de vue ne manque pas, les paysages exceptionnels sont de renommer internationale, la pierre, l'eau, le vent, la lumière et la présence séculaire des hommes qui s'y sont implantés ont façonnés ce territoire.
nl: In het midden van Provence, tussen de Rhône en de Durance, Alpilles ("aupilho" in Provençaalse) wordt ingesteld dat de scène voor een bergketen. De route in het vertrekstation van St-Rémy-de-Provence, een lus is een reis terug in de tijd (via Domitia, Santiago GR653D, cursus Vincent Van Gogh...), van de hoogste oudheid tot onze dagen maar in de ontdekking van de minerale, dierlijke en plantaardige regering. Na het oversteken van het platteland, de route volgt een weg uitgestippeld in de natuur, voetafdruk beschermde gebieden, de Casey en carrière sites geregeld vanwege de zeldzame soorten die live er en verschillende landschappen die er zijn. In deze cursus, ontbreekt standpunten niet aan, de uitzonderlijke landschappen zijn hernoemen international, steen, water, wind, licht en de seculiere aanwezigheid van mannen die zich bevinden dit land hebben gevormd.
es: En medio de la Provenza, entre el Ródano y Durance, Alpilles ("aupilho" en provenzal) establece el escenario para una cadena montañosa. La ruta que enlaza la salida de St-Rémy-de-Provence, es un viaje al pasado (vía Domitia, Santiago GR653D, curso Vincent Van Gogh...), de la más alta antigüedad a nuestros días, pero en el descubrimiento del reino animal, vegetal y mineral. Después de cruzar el mundo rural, la ruta sigue un camino marcado hacia fuera en la naturaleza, huella protegido sitios, el Casey y sitios carrera regulación por las raras especies vivo allí y diferentes paisajes que existen. A lo largo de este curso, no carece de puntos de vista, los paisajes excepcionales son renombrar internacional, piedra, agua, viento, luz, y la presencia secular de los hombres se encuentran han dado forma a esta tierra.
